title: Predict Weather Changes Using Natural Indicators
brief: Use wind, clouds, smoke patterns, and animal behavior to predict incoming weather changes.
steps: Step 1: Determine wind direction by dropping leaves/grass or watching treetops.
Step 2: Watch for rapidly shifting winds which indicate unsettled atmosphere and likely weather changes.
Step 3: Observe smoke - rising in thin vertical column indicates fair weather, low rising or flattened smoke indicates storms.
Step 4: Watch birds and insects - they fly lower than normal in heavy, moisture-laden air before rain.
Step 5: Note bee activity increases before fair weather, while most other insect activity increases before storms.
Step 6: Recognize low-pressure fronts: slow/imperceptible winds, heavy humid air, more pronounced wilderness odors, sharper sounds that carry farther.
warnings: Low-pressure fronts promise bad weather that will likely linger for several days.
Plan accordingly for extended poor weather when multiple indicators point to storms.
